actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to provide that in civil actions brought under the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 where the United States is a plaintiff, a prevailing defendant may recover a reasonable attorney's fee and other reasonable litigation costs.

summary.text: Amends the Occupational Safety and Heath Act of 1970 to require that the United States pay prevailing defendants in civil suits under such Act a reasonable attorney's fee and other reasonable litigation costs.

titles.title: A bill to provide that in civil actions brought under the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 where the United States is a plaintiff, a prevailing defendant may recover a reasonable attorney's fee and other reasonable litigation costs.
